conclusion: Analyze the motion of the electron in the electric field using initial velocity and exit angle.
Initial kinetic energy Ki is calculated using Ki = 1/2 m v0^2.
Final velocity components are vx = v cos(30°) and vy = v sin(30°).
Kinetic energy is conserved in the absence of non-conservative forces.
Initial kinetic energy Ki equals final kinetic energy Kf.
Final kinetic energy Kf is given by Kf = 1/2 m v^2.
Since kinetic energy is conserved, v0^2 = v^2, hence v = v0.
Final kinetic energy Kf is the same as initial kinetic energy Ki.
Substitute given values to calculate Kf = 7.28 × 10^-18 J.
The kinetic energy of the electron at point C is 7.28 × 10^-18 J.
